subject: Cybersecurity
title: Phone Phreaking: Where Hacking Began
description: A short lesson to help you apply Phone Phreaking: Where Hacking Began.

hook.text: In the 1960s, a toy whistle from a cereal box could make free phone calls worldwide.

buildup.text: Phone phreakers discovered that a 2600 Hz tone could trick AT&T's switching systems into granting free access.

discovery.text: John Draper, aka Captain Crunch, used that cereal whistle to explore the entire phone network.

twist.text: Steve Jobs and Steve Wozniak built and sold 'blue boxes' that automated phreaking before founding Apple.

climax.text: Phone phreaking proved that understanding a system's design lets you control it.

punchline.text: Apple started with a hack, not a computer.

quiz.question: What frequency could trick AT&T's phone systems?
